5.28.19  11:08 pm   I've been thinking a lot about how I'm going to die eventually. At first I was kinda sad, but I warmed up to the idea! After all, I haven't been alive for the billions of years preceding my birth. And being not alive wasn't that bad.

The thing is, I'm going to be really disappointed when I do have to die. I don't want to say goodbye to all my life experiences - the things I've done, the things I want to do, the people I love. I'll never know the things people will discover in the far-off future.

Thinking about giving that all up makes me want to cry, honestly. I don't want to die. I really REALLY don't want to die!!!!

What are your thoughts on this? Any tips

5.28.19  10:48 pm   i have seen two points.  one point arguing that destroying every particle in your body and then reforming it would kill the 'you' you but give birth to a new someone who is entirely you and to their knowledge everything continued as normal, but the 'you' you is really gone.  The other argument is that this new exact rearrangement of particles is you and would be the 'you' you and everything is fine.  I have a hard time with each one but i think i lean towards the idea that the 'you' you won't be there anymore more when it is reformed.  

     i think this idea for some reason blends in with my thoughts about reincarnation.  i also think there are extra problems to the situation like, what if when your particles are reformed they form 2 or 3 copies?  

     then, if 'you' you are still around, which one is you?  are both you?  would it be like a clonal colony hive mind kind of thing?  that doesn't make sense to me and damages the argument that 'you' you would be around.  if everything is happening, perhaps what we are experiencing in this life happens infinite times.  if it does, do 'i' really get to experience that many times?  

     it doesn't feel like that.  

     unless this is the first time and i am in for a big whopping surprise when i die.  these things have just been really burning into my brain.  any thoughts?  thanks for listening.  i hope the new video is bringing meaning and joy.

5.28.19  12:43 pm   What would happen if the sun were to miraculously transform into an onion?

      Like if it was a hot, sunny day, and everything goes dark. You look up, and you just see the biggest onion ever where the sun once was. Would there be a daylight cycle?

      Would all life on Earth perish?

      Would this have any major effect on the rest of the solar system?

     I'm genuinely curious.

5.28.19  2:48 am   i've been on a devastatingly long break from creating music (6 months at least), and it's absolutely killing me. i just lost it at the height of my career because of an insane amount of pressure (self-inflicted, mostly) to sound good and be an amazing pianist. also, i've been traveling this week and i'm staying in a house with a few other musicians. tonight i heard someone basically hitting the keys and playing with some cute chords, no recording or end goal or anything, just spending time with the instrument. and it filled me with relief and determination. because i guess ive been waaay too much of a perfectionist- and i've been too afraid to make mistakes while playing, to the point of deleting my confidence to even play. but, if this person can just hit some keys at 2 am and still manage to get some enjoyment and meaning from it, fuck what the hell am i holding back for? i forgot why i even fell in love with music: what the fuck is music and how can i make it myself

5.28.19  2:13 am   in your La dee da day oh song thing (which is amazin' btw) do the lyrics just got home, got no home la-dee-da-de where did it go oh no i can't go home mean like, so you like a girl right, but to get to her (or something) you needa be a rebel against your parents or something XD and you end up getting to her, and a full fulfillment of actually being able to listen to La de Da de Da de Da de Day Oh happily with the good times being now, but you can't get back to your home or whatever cuz/but you got to this girl.
